terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs.sensors
Class AwtMouseButtonSensor

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs.sensors.AwtMouseButtonSensor
public class AwtMouseButtonSensor
extends java.lang.Object

An input sensor that monitors a display for mouse button actions. Use setButtons() to specify which button states are recognized. Events are generated only while the mouse is over the display and when the button state changes.

Note that a click occurs any time a mouse button is released thus Input.CLICK_NONE should never occur in setInputClick().

addEventSource

getEventOut

public InputButtonSplitter getEventOut()
Gets the event output splitter. Use it to add and remove event targets.

Returns:
Reference to the event out splitter. Never null.

setButtons

public void setButtons(int buttons)
Sets which button states will activate this sensor. This sensor is activated if any of the specified button states change. Note that typically button clicks should only be allowed on the primary button.

Parameters:
buttons - Button flags (Input.BUTTON_???). Defaults to Input.BUTTON_ALL If BUTTON_NONE or BUTTON_IGNORE no events will be generated.

setInputButton

Call to send button state change.

Call to send click count.
